001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonPropertyOrder;
005
006import java.time.DayOfWeek;
007import java.time.Instant;
008import java.time.LocalDateTime;
009import java.time.Month;
010import java.time.ZoneOffset;
011import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
012import java.time.format.TextStyle;
013import java.util.Locale;
014import java.util.Objects;
015import java.util.function.Supplier;
016
017/**
018 * This class is used to represent the date-time types as a triplet of parts,
019 * which could be displayed in three separate columns with natural chronological order.
020 * This is just a simple wrapper over standard {@link LocalDateTime} from JDK.
021 * <hr/>
022 * For a date-time that could be received from terminal in following way <pre>{@code
023 *     ...> date -u
024 *     Wed Oct 15 06:03:38 UTC 2025}</pre>
025 * the properties of this class will be:
026 * <table>
027 *     <tr><th>method</th><th>value</th></tr>
028 *     <tr><td>{@link #getYearAndMonth()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10"}</td></tr>
029 *     <tr><td>{@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek()}</td><td>{@code "15 (Wed)"}</td></tr>
030 *     <tr><td>{@link #getHoursMinutes()}</td><td>{@code "06:03"}</td></tr>
031 *     <tr><td>{@link #dumpNoWeek()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10-15 06:03"}</td></tr>
032 *     <tr><td>{@link #dump()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10-15 (Wed) 06:03"}</td></tr>
033 * </table>
034 * <hr/>
035 * As far as <b>{@code git}</b>-repository provides the commit-time in UTC time-zone - this class also represents
036 * all it's parts for UTC time-zone and day of week corresponds to {@link Locale#US}
037 * ({@code Mon}, {@code Tue}, {@code Wed}, {@code Thu}, {@code Fri}, {@code Sat}, {@code Sun}) by default .
038 */
039@JsonPropertyOrder({
040    "year", "month", "dayOfMoth", "dayOfWeek", "hours", "minutes", "epochSeconds"
041})
042public class DateTimeTriplet {
043
044    private final LocalDateTime localDateTimeUTC;
045
046    /**
047     * @param epochSeconds the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}
048     */
049    public DateTimeTriplet(long epochSeconds) {
050        this(epochSeconds, 0);
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * @param epochSeconds the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}
055     * @param nanoOfSecond the nanosecond within the second, from 0 to 999,999,999
056     */
057    public DateTimeTriplet(long epochSeconds, int nanoOfSecond) {
058        this(LocalDateTime.ofEpochSecond(epochSeconds, nanoOfSecond, ZoneOffset.UTC));
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * @param instant a standard representation of date-time instant in Java as {@link Instant}
063     */
064    public DateTimeTriplet(Instant instant) {
065        this(LocalDateTime.ofInstant(instant, ZoneOffset.UTC));
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * @param localDateTimeUTC a date-time in {@link ZoneOffset#UTC} time-zone as {@link LocalDateTime}
070     */
071    public DateTimeTriplet(LocalDateTime localDateTimeUTC) {
072        this.localDateTimeUTC = Objects.requireNonNull(localDateTimeUTC)
073            .withSecond(0)
074            .withNano(0);
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * This provider could be helpful in unit-tests that allows to avoid an unnecessary mocking
079     */
080    public static Supplier<Instant> NOW_PROVIDER = Instant::now;
081
082    /**
083     * The default format of the day of the week is English USA three letters
084     * (like {@code Mon}, {@code Tue}, {@code Wed}, {@code Thu}, {@code Fri}, {@code Sat}, {@code Sun})
085     */
086    public static Supplier<TextStyle> DAY_OF_WEEK__TEXT_STYLE = () -> TextStyle.SHORT;
087
088    /**
089     * The default names of days of the week correspond to English USA locale ({@link Locale#US})
090     */
091    public static Supplier<Locale> DAY_OF_WEEK__LOCALE = () -> Locale.US;
092
093    /**
094     * @return an instance of {@link DateTimeTriplet} that corresponds to current date-time
095     */
096    public static DateTimeTriplet now() {
097        return new DateTimeTriplet(NOW_PROVIDER.get());
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Getting the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}
102     * according to underlying value of {@link #getLocalDateTime()}.
103     *
104     * @return the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}.
105     */
106    public long getEpochSeconds() {
107        return localDateTimeUTC.toEpochSecond(ZoneOffset.UTC);
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Getting the underlying value of standard {@link LocalDateTime} from JDK
112     *
113     * @return underlying value of standard {@link LocalDateTime} from JDK
114     */
115    @JsonIgnore
116    public LocalDateTime getLocalDateTime() {
117        return localDateTimeUTC;
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Getting the value of year
122     *
123     * @return integer value of year
124     */
125    public int getYear() {
126        return localDateTimeUTC.getYear();
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Getting the value of month as enumeration {@link Month}
131     *
132     * @return a value of month as enumeration {@link Month}
133     */
134    public Month getMonth() {
135        return localDateTimeUTC.getMonth();
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * @return <b>the first part</b> of date-time triplet that contains dash-separated
140     *          {@link #getYear() year} and {@link #getMonth() month}
141     */
142    @JsonIgnore
143    public String getYearAndMonth() {
144        return String.format("%04d-%02d", this.getYear(), this.getMonth().getValue());
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * @return an ordinal number of day within the month (from {@code 1} to {@code 31})
149     */
150    public int getDayOfMoth() {
151        return localDateTimeUTC.getDayOfMonth();
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * @return a day of week as enumartion {@link DayOfWeek}
156     */
157    public DayOfWeek getDayOfWeek() {
158        return localDateTimeUTC.getDayOfWeek();
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * @return <b>the second part</b> of date-time triplet that contains {@link #getDayOfMoth()} the day of month}
163     *          and {@link #getDayOfWeek() the day of week as 3-letters acronym}
164     *          in a format described in the declaration of {@link DateTimeTriplet}
165     */
166    @JsonIgnore
167    public String getDayOfMonthAndWeek() {
168        String dayOfWeekStr = this.getDayOfWeek().getDisplayName(
169            DAY_OF_WEEK__TEXT_STYLE.get(),
170            DAY_OF_WEEK__LOCALE.get()
171        );
172        return String.format("%02d (%s)", this.getDayOfMoth(), dayOfWeekStr);
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * @return a value of <i>hours</i> in the half-open range {@code [0..24)}
177     */
178    public int getHours() {
179        return localDateTimeUTC.getHour();
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * @return a value of <i>minutes</i> in the half-open range {@code [0..60)}
184     */
185    public int getMinutes() {
186        return localDateTimeUTC.getMinute();
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * @return <b>the third part</b> of date-time triplet that contains colon{@code ':'}-separated
191     *          {@link #getHours() hours} and {@link #getMinutes() minutes}
192     */
193    @JsonIgnore
194    public String getHoursMinutes() {
195        return String.format("%02d:%02d", this.getHours(), this.getMinutes());
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * @return concatenation of 3 parts: <pre>
200     * {@link #getYearAndMonth() yearAndMonth}{@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek() '-'dayOfMonthAndWeek}{@link #getHoursMinutes() ' 'hoursMinutes}
201     * </pre>
202     */
203    public String dump() {
204        return String.format("%s-%s %s", getYearAndMonth(), getDayOfMonthAndWeek(), getHoursMinutes());
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * @return the same as {@link #dump()}, but without day of week:<pre>
209     * {@link #getYearAndMonth() yearAndMonth}{@link #getDayOfMoth() '-'dayOfMonth}{@link #getHoursMinutes() ' 'hoursMinutes}
210     * </pre>
211     */
212    public String dumpNoWeek() {
213        return String.format("%s-%02d %s", getYearAndMonth(), getDayOfMoth(), getHoursMinutes());
214    }
215
216    /**
217     * @return string-representation of corresponding {@link Instant} in format like {@code 2007-12-03T10:15:30.00Z}.
218     * @see DateTimeFormatter#ISO_INSTANT ISO_INSTANT
219     */
220    public String dumpIsoInstant() {
221        return "" + Instant.ofEpochSecond(this.getEpochSeconds());
222    }
223
224    @Override
225    public boolean equals(Object thatObj) {
226        if (thatObj instanceof DateTimeTriplet that) {
227            return this.localDateTimeUTC.equals(that.localDateTimeUTC);
228        } else {
229            return false;
230        }
231    }
232
233    @Override
234    public int hashCode() {
235        return this.localDateTimeUTC.hashCode();
236    }
237
238    @Override
239    public String toString() {
240        return this.dump();
241    }
242}
